column4: After installing KDE on a Ubuntu server, the server will no longer boot normally (it can however be booted in recovery mode). Trying to boot normally results in a blank screen with the cursor blinking in the upper left hand corner. Is there any way to fix this? This is with an encrypted lvn file system.
what is the graphics card?
I don't know. I'll find out and report back.
but I had Kubuntu workstation installed before, and all worked fine.
well I've seen that happen with my nvidia card when the kernel upgraded and I had to reinstall the driver
how do I reinstall the driver. I'm brand now to Linux, only been using it for a few months.
depends on the graphics card ;)
ok. I'll find out and report back.
the video card is built into the motherboard, which is an Asus P5GC-MX.
intel I guess?
yes.
I don't know, I've only seen that with the binary nvidia drivers... you could try reconfiguring xorg
...which is done with sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
ok. I'll try that.
I get a message saying "x-server-xorg is not installed" because the file doesn't exist.
there's your problem...
er it's xserver-xorg... not x-server
also before that I noticed that several line under "Loading AppArmor profiles" there is a line that says, "*Setting sensor limits...  [fail}"
is there any way to install xserver-xorg besides using aptitude?
are you sure it isn't installed? it looks like you issued the command wrong.
how did you install KDE exactly?
under Uninstalled Packages in aptitude there is a choice for x11. But it is not able to install gwenview for some reason.
okay? I don't really have time to continue
ok. Thanks for your time so far. I appreciate it much.
